com.rcsexample.basnlib

Class BluetoothConnectionService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rcsexample.basnlib.BluetoothConnectionService

  • public class BluetoothConnectionService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is designed to handle the connection with the Bluetooth sensor. It should be instantiated only once.

    Use it to initiate or terminate connections, receive and send raw data and for recognizing Bluetooth connection related errors. Get your data by using the callbacks provided by the BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener interface and registering as a listener.

    A reference to an object of this class is also used in the DataProvider class to receive the raw data from a bluetooth sensor and pass it to decoding.

    The code is derived from the BluetoothChatService of the Android Bluetooth Chat sample applicaion.

    Author:
    laurenz

      Classes that implement this interface and register as a listener will have the callback methods called.

    • Method Detail

      • registerListener

        public void registerListener(BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener l)
        Register as a listener to receive callbacks via the BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener interface. The listener you want to register is most likely "this".
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to register

      • unregisterListener

        public void unregisterListener(BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener l)
        Stop calling the functions of the BluetoothConnectionService.BluetoothConnectionListener interface for the given listener.
        Parameters:
        the - listener to unregister

      • getState

        public int getState()
        Return the current connection state.
        See Also:
        STATE_NONE, STATE_CONNECTING, STATE_CONNECTED

      • connect

        public void connect(BluetoothDevice device)
        Start the ConnectThread to initiate a connection to a remote device.

        If you don't have a BluetoothDevice, get one by calling BluetoothAdapter#getRemoteDevice(String address)

        Parameters:
        device - The BluetoothDevice to connect

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop all threads (and thus terminate a possibly established connection)

      • connected

        public void connected(BluetoothSocket socket,
             BluetoothDevice device)
        Start the ConnectedThread to begin managing a Bluetooth connection.

        If you want to initiate a new connection, use connect(BluetoothDevice).

        Parameters:
        socket - The BluetoothSocket on which the connection was made
        device - The BluetoothDevice that has been connected

      • write

        public boolean write(byte[] out)
        Write to the ConnectedThread in an unsynchronized manner. Use this to send something to you remote device.
        Parameters:
        out - The bytes to write
        Returns:
        true if write successful, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ConnectedThread#write(byte[])
